com.wingfoot.soap.encoding
Class AbstractSerializer

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.wingfoot.soap.encoding.AbstractSerializer
Direct Known Subclasses:
LiteralDeserializer, LiteralSerializer
public abstract class AbstractSerializer
extends java.lang.Object

Converts Java objects to XML stubs that are then part of the SOAP payload. All serializes, including custom serializers are subclasses of AbstractSerializer. Method in this class are utility methods that convert specific objects to XML stubs. Concrete implementations of this class address serializations based on Section V encoding rules or literal encoding rules.

Method Detail

serialize

public void serialize(java.lang.String parameterName,
                      XSDType type,
                      java.lang.Object parameterValue,
                      boolean isNillable)
               throws SOAPException
Writes a parameter as a XML. The type of the parameter is an inbuilt XML schema.
Parameters:
parameterName - the name of the parameter.
type - the XSDType that encapsulates the inbuilt XML schema type.
parameterValue - the value of the parameter. Primitive type are wrapped.
isNillable - true if xsi:nil=true is to be written if the parameterValue is null; false otherwise.
Throws:
SOAPException - if the XSDType does not encapsulate an inbuilt XML schema type.

serialize

public void serialize(java.lang.String parameterName,
                      java.lang.String parameterNS,
                      XSDType type,
                      java.lang.Object parameterValue,
                      boolean isNillable)
               throws SOAPException
Overriden method that writes a parameter as a XML. The type of the parameter is an inbuilt XML schema.
Parameters:
parameterName - the name of the parameter.
parameterNS - the namespace associated with the parameter.
type - the XSDType that encapsulates the inbuilt XML schema type.
parameterValue - the value of the parameter. Primitive type are wrapped.
isNillable - true if xsi:nil=true is to be written if the parameterValue is null; false otherwise.
Throws:
SOAPException - if the XSDType does not encapsulate an inbuilt XML schema type.

shouldElementBeNamespaceQualified

public boolean shouldElementBeNamespaceQualified(Element e)
Given an element, determines if the element should be namespace prefixed while writing the payload. The namespace is the targetNamespace of the schema. The rules to determine this is as follows:
  • If the element is a global element (immediate parent is a <schema>) then the element is namespace qualified.
  • If the element is a local element (immediate parent is NOT a <schema>) but the form attribute in the element is true, then it is namespace qualified.
  • if the element is a local element (immediate parent is NOT a <schema>) and the form attribute in the element is false but the elementFormDefault attribute in the <schema> is true, then the element is namespace qualified.
    Parameters:
    e - the Element to interrogate.
    Returns:
    boolean true if the element is to be namespace prefixed; false otherwise.

    • getNamespaceForPart

    public java.lang.String getNamespaceForPart(Part part)
    Determines if a Part must be namespace prefixed in the SOAP payload. If the Part encapsulates a Type then it is not namespace qualified. If the Part encapsulates an Element, then the rules governing them are described in the method shouldElementBeNamespaceQualfied.
    Parameters:
    part - Part to interrogate.
    Returns:
    String the namespace of the Part; null if the Part should NOT be namespace qualified.

    shouldAttributeBeNamespaceQualified

    public boolean shouldAttributeBeNamespaceQualified(Attribute attribute)
    Given an attribute, determines if the attribute should be namespace prefixed while writing the payload. The namespace is the targetNamespace of the schema. The rules to determine this is as follows:
  • If the attribute is a global attribute (immediate parent is a <schema>) then the attribute is namespace qualified.
  • If the element is a local attribute (immediate parent is NOT a <schema>) but the form attribute in the attribute is true, then it is namespace qualified.
  • if the attribute is a local attribute (immediate parent is NOT a <schema>) and the form attribute in the attribute is false but the attributeFormDefault attribute in the <schema> is true, then the element is namespace qualified.
    Parameters:
    attribute - the Attribute to interrogate.
    Returns:
    boolean true if the attribute is to be namespace prefixed; false otherwise.

    • getParameterNameForPart

    public java.lang.String getParameterNameForPart(Part part)
    Given a message Part, returns the parameterName that must go in the SOAP payload. If the Part contains a Type as its xsi:type, then the part name is the parameter name. If the Part contains an Element as its xsi:type, then the part name is the Element name.
    Parameters:
    part - the Part name.
    Returns:
    String the parameter name; returns null if the input part is null.

    getPartType

    public Type getPartType(Part part)
    Takes a Part and determines if the Part and returns back the Type of the Part.
    Parameters:
    part - the Part
    Returns:
    Type of the Part. It could be a XSDType, a SimpleType or a ComplexType. It is never a TypeReference. Returns null if the Type cannot be determined.

    getTypeFromReference

    public Type getTypeFromReference(TypeReference tr)
    Takes a TypeReference and returns back a Type that is refered to by the TypeReference. This method is called from getPartType and only works if the TypeReference is pointing to a Type (and not an Element).
    Parameters:
    tr - the TypeReference.
    Returns:
    Type that is being refered to; null if no Type exists.

    serializeDate

    public void serializeDate(java.lang.String parameterNS,
                          java.lang.String parameterName,
                          XSDType partType,
                          java.lang.Object parameterValue)
    Converts a Date to XML.
    Parameters:
    parameterNS - the namespace of the parameter; null if the element must not have a namespace.
    parameterName - the name of the parameter.
    partType - XSDType encapsulating xsd:date or xsd:dateTime
    parameterValue - the Date object.

    deserializeDate

    public java.util.Date deserializeDate(java.lang.String strDate)
    Converts a String representation of Date to java.util.Date.
    Parameters:
    strDate - the String representation of Date. Usually the String representation is represented as a xsd:date element in a SOAP payload.
    Returns:
    java.util.Date the xsd:date in Date format.

    getArrayFromVector

    public java.lang.Object getArrayFromVector(java.util.Vector v)
                                    throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
    Takes a Vector and returns back the elements of the Vector as an array. If the Vector is hetrogeneous, then an Object[] is returned; if the array is homogenous, then the suitable array (String[], Integer[] as the case may be) is returned. If Vector is null or the size is 0, then null is returned.

    skipTillStartTag

    public void skipTillStartTag(org.kxml.parser.XmlParser parser)
                      throws java.io.IOException
    Takes an instance of XmlParser and reads it until a START_TAG is encountered or the end of the Xml Document is encountered
    Parameters:
    parser - the Xml document encapsulated as an XmlParser.
    Throws:
    java.io.IOException - if an error occurs while reading the parser.

    getNamespaceForOperation

    public java.lang.String getNamespaceForOperation(Binding binding,
                                                 Operation operation,
                                                 Message message)
                                          throws SOAPException
    Gets namespace for an operation. In a WSDL, the namespace is available as part of the binding operation. It identifies the namespace for the <input> and <output> messages. Only applicable for RPC operation. Exception thrown if the operation is not found in Binding
